node.title: Question about the hasComponentByName funcion in THM

node.bodyText: I see. I mistake FlowModelSinglePhase for a Component class. I derive the Component directly and the error is gone. Thank you!

here is my mesh block, just in case it's mesh related problem:

Hello
Seeing pretty big memory numbers in the log and exodus output causes serialization so even more memory consumption. It could just be that you are running out of memory. Could you please check that?
Do you have the hash for the commit before the update and after the update?
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume

Seeing pretty big memory numbers in the log and exodus output causes serialization so even more memory consumption. It could just be that you are running out of memory. Could you please check that?

I still have 50% of RAM unsued when it reached that point

Do you have the hash for the commit before the update and after the update?

No, I tried to use the previous version of MOOSE (I saved it late 2020) it's now working just fine, guess i'm stuck with the old version for now

git log will give you the hash of the commit.
between the case that works and the one that does not, is it just the mesh that's different?

git log will give you the hash of the commit.
between the case that works and the one that does not, is it just the mesh that's different?

Hi Guillaume,
I'm not very familiar with git, but I will have a look.
note: the mesh and the input file are exactly the same for both tests.
Kind regards,
Traiwit
all good now, seems like the new moose/libmesh doesnt like this line const_cast<InputParameters &>(_pars).clear();

node.title: PorousFlow doc on GitHub
node.bodyText:
Hello,
Hope you are doing well.
Just wanted to inform you that PorousFlow doc on Github faces "404 not found error" or "Unable to render expression". Nothing important, just wanted to let you know if you want to fix it. Thanks.
Like theses:
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/modules/porous_flow/doc/content/modules/porous_flow/capillary_pressure.md#constant
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/PorousFlowCapillaryPressureConst.md
Best regards,
Sina

Well it is not just PorousFlow. Lots of hyperlinks do not work in doc directories.
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/UserObjects/PropertyReadFile/nprop
Best regards,
Sina

Hello
You are accessing these links from the github interface, but they are not made for this. They need to be parsed by our documentation system to create the website.
Please see the following pages that correspond to the links you pasted:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/capillary_pressure.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/userobjects/PorousFlowCapillaryPressureConst.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/userobject/PropertyReadFile.html
Best,
Guillaume

node.title: Reading Capillary pressures from data file in PorousFlow
node.bodyText:
Hi,
Hope you are fine.
I am new to MOOSE and its modules as well. I have read the documents and searched through discussions but did not find similar questions. I wanted to know if we can give our properties to moose? For example instead of using predefined Capillary Pressure functions i. e. constant, VG, BC, etc., we give a csv file containing CP vs saturation. Thanks.
Best regards,
Sina

Hello
You can read CSV files with a number of objects in MOOSE, but especially functions.
For example:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/functions/PiecewiseLinear.html
Functions are usually dependent on time and position.
But in your code you can call functions with any arguments you like to replace time, x, y and z.
Guillaume

Hello
There s unfortunately no way I know to recover from borked conda environments.
you ll have to remove it and try again. And if it doesn’t work then remove mamba and follow our instructions for getting started from the beginning again
Guillaume

Thanks Guillaume.
Unfortunately, I had no progress in installation. I am a Windows user and working with WSL is really new to me. I cannot even remove mamba which is a little confusing for me and I have no clue how to do so. I tried "conda remove mamba" but it is stuck and shows only:
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json):
failed
CondaHTTPError: HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED for url https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64/repodata.json
Elapsed: -
An HTTP error occurred when trying to retrieve this URL.
HTTP errors are often intermittent, and a simple retry will get you on your way.
'https//conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64'
I appreciate your help if you can provide me with information on how to progress.
Amin

Hello
Just delete the folder where mamba / conda is installed.
It should be mamba if you followed the online instructions
Guillaume

rm -rf /home/amin/mambaforge3
Should delete Conda... Once you do the above, close out of WSL, and re-open WSL. Then try to run through the installation steps again.
Note: The second time you received an error connecting to https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64/repodata.json, could actually have been my fault.
At 8:36 AM MST, I deleted much of the indexing cache that was present to build anew. It's possible you attempted to connect during that time frame.

Hi
I removed and re-installed mamba successfully, but the first problem (TIMEOUT error) is still the case.
I reckon it's related to my internet connection. I found the following guide on MOOSE website (Troubleshooting guide for conda):

TIMEOUT
If your tests fail due to timeout errors, it is most likely you have a good installation, but a slow machine (or slow filesystem). You can adjust the amount of time that the TestHarness allows a test to run before timing out, by adding a paramater to your test file:
[Tests]
[./timeout]
type = RunApp
input = my_input_file.i
max_time = 300   <-- time in seconds before a timeout occurs. 300 is the default for all tests.
[../]
[]

But I have no clue how should I implement such a code.
Amin

The troubleshooting steps you are referring to are for ./run_tests test timeouts. Are you saying you are still receiving something similar to:
https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64      ??.?MB @  ??.?MB/s 0 failed  9.0s
Download error (28) Timeout was reached [https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/noarch/repodata.json]
Connection timeout after 9000 ms
Yes. This is what I receive after running "mamba create -n moose moose-tools moose-libmesh" after around 9 seconds. I'm really wondering what could cause this issue.

What happens when you: curl https://conda.software.inl.gov/public This is a simple bash command that reads a url, and prints the contents on the screen. A successful run will look like: 301 Moved Permanently

Moved Permanently

The document has moved here.

It returns:
curl: (28) Failed to connect to conda.software.inl.gov port 443: Connection timed out
Are you able to browse to the following address using your browser on the same machine: https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/
Yes, I am. Out of the WSL everything works and I can access the link above.

I am not sure why your WSL would not allow you to that address, while the host machine does. Is this some work machine at a lab or some other location which may lay down access restriction rules or some such??

I should say it's my personal machine. But the thing is there are some restrictions in my location (Iran) to access some websites. I think something is wrong with my internet connection and I may try this some time later. Internet quality and restrictions fluctuate in my location from time to time.

I am betting your Windows machine is routing through a Proxy, while the WSL guest machine is not configured to do so. I don't know how you would figure out your Proxy settings in Windows, but if you can figure them out; you would want to export those addresses like so:
export http_proxy=<your proxy server>
export https_proxy=<your proxy server>
Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9445489/performing-http-requests-with-curl-using-proxy
Conda will use the same environment variables... Edit: That is to say, once you can get:
export http_proxy=<your proxy server>
export https_proxy=<your proxy server>
curl https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
to work, so should mamba commands.
Yes, I have to use a Proxy. I tried several ways to to use curl with a proxy bud all of them fail to connect to my Proxy server. It really beats me.

node.title: Fluid Properties Build Error
node.bodyText:
Attempting to run the test file located at modules/porous_flow/test/tests/infiltration_and_drainage/rd01.i but am running into an issue where the FLUID_PROPERTIES module doesn't appear to build.
Getting the following errors when attempting to run the test file:
*** ERROR ***
.../testing_infiltration.i:85: section 'FluidProperties' does not have an associated "Action".
Did you misspell it?
.../testing_infiltration.i:86: section 'FluidProperties/the_simple_fluid' does not have an associated "Action".
Did you misspell it?

I have attempted to make clobberall and am still getting the same issue.
I have included the relevant sections of the makefile below:

ALL_MODULES                 := no

CHEMICAL_REACTIONS          := no
CONTACT                     := yes
EXTERNAL_PETSC_SOLVER       := no
FLUID_PROPERTIES            := yes
FSI                         := no
FUNCTIONAL_EXPANSION_TOOLS  := no
GEOCHEMISTRY                := no
HEAT_CONDUCTION             := yes
LEVEL_SET                   := no
MISC                        := no
NAVIER_STOKES               := no
PERIDYNAMICS                := no
PHASE_FIELD                 := no
POROUS_FLOW                 := yes
RAY_TRACING                 := no
REACTOR                     := no
RDG                         := no
RICHARDS                    := no
STOCHASTIC_TOOLS            := no
TENSOR_MECHANICS            := yes
XFEM                        := no

What am I missing here?

Hello
the syntax has changed recently. It seems you are trying to use the new syntax with an old MOOSE
If you are using an up-to-date MOOSE then you can use this syntax. If not you need to use
[Modules]
      [FluidProperties]
          [the_simple_fluid]
..
[]
[]
[]

node.title: Transfer Old Values
node.bodyText: Is there a way to transfer old values of a variable when using multiapp?

Yes, the trick is to use an AuxVariable to store the old value. Something like
[Variables]
  [u]
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [u_old]
    [AuxKernel]
      type = ParsedAux
      function = 'u'
      args = 'u'
      execute_on = TIMESTEP_END
    []
  []
[]

Ok, that's what I did before. I believe that fails when using more than one fixed point iteration. Since the parent app at the end of the first fixed point iteration will update u_old to be u, when it transfers again, it will send the same values as the current u. If only there was an option like FIXED_POINT_END. I am creating an OldAux AuxKernel that I will run at TimeStepBegin on the child app, but I feel like there might be a use for FIXED_POINT_END.
yeah, I don't like abusing TIMESTEP_END for FPI_END either. If someone has the time to fix it I'm all for it. But maybe @YaqiWang has some special needs for that?

the parent app at the end of the first fixed point iteration will update u_old to be u

Are you sure about this? You can use this to copy the old values into an aux var:
[AuxVariables]
  [u_old][]
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [copy_old]
    type = SelfAux
    variable = u_old
    v = u
    implicit = false
    execute_on = timestep_begin
  []
[]

I think it should work. Even though the aux kernel will be executed multiple times during fixed point iteration at every time step, it won't change u_old.

For the real timestep_begin timestep_end execute flags, we basically derived a new executioner with two new custom execute flags and let object executed on those. timestep_begin and timestep_end is so widely used in MOOSE and apps, renaming them and checking all objects whether on timestep_begin or fixed_point_begin would be a real headache.

If I wanted my child app to run before my parent app, would your solution work? Does a parent app run all AuxKernels with timestep_begin before it transfers to the child app when using TransientMultiApp on TIMESTEP_BEGIN?
if you wanted to do that you'd execute the auxkernel on timestep_end to make it work
btw there is the SelfAux to do this shorter than a ParsedAux

If the aux kernel and the multiapp are both on timestep_begin, multiapp/transfer will get executed first. They will not see the updated solution at the first fixed point iteration. The later iterations will see the updated solution and the solution will remain unchanged (I hope I understand this right). If you make the copy (aux kernel) on timestep_end with implicit = true, it will get executed on inside the current fixed point iteration, so it possibly won't work. If implicit = false, it will be the same as implicit = true plus on timestep_begin.

@GiudGiud
Are you saying that this system would work? I think this would have a different problem. For the first FPI, it would send over "older" solution (for the new timestep), then for every other FPI, it would send over the correct old solution.
[AuxVariables]
  [copy_old]
    type = SelfAux
    variable = u_old
    v = u
    implicit = false
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
[]

good point.
Ok we do need a fixed_point_end, fixed_point_begin execute_on for this then

node.title: How to distinguish different grains
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE experts,
I want to simulate the evolution of inclusions in two grains, I wrote a sub-module to simulate the anisotropic mobility with reference to Kobayashi's paper. I want the anisotropic parameter to take different values in different grains. Here is the code of the initial conditions, eta denotes the grain, c denotes the inclusions.
[ICs]
[./eta1]
type = SmoothSuperellipsoidIC
block = 1
a = 2
b = 2
n = 2
x1 = -10
y1 = 0
variable = eta1
invalue = 0
outvalue = 1.0
int_width = 0.07
[../]
[./eta2]
type = BoundingBoxIC
block = 2
x1 = 0
y1 = -10
x2 = 50
y2 = 10
variable = eta2
inside = 1.0
outside = 0.0
int_width = 0.05
[../]
[./c]
type = SmoothSuperellipsoidIC
a = 2
b = 2
n = 2
x1 = -10
y1 = 0
variable = c
invalue = -1.0
outvalue = 1.0
int_width = 0.07
[../]
[]
When I use the block function to distinguish different grains, Inclusions cannot cross grain boundaries. Can anyone give me some advice?
Thank you very much.
Best,

node.title: Material property 'A', requested by 'mobility' is not defined on block 0
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I was trying to solve a phase field problem. After running, it gave me an error message:
 *** ERROR *** The following error occurred in the object "MOOSE Problem", of type "FEProblem". Material property 'A', requested by 'mobility' is not defined on block 0 Material property 'A', requested by 'mobility_face' is not defined on block 0 Material property 'A', requested by 'mobility_neighbor' is not defined on block 0
The complete code is attached as follows:
`[Mesh]
type = GeneratedMesh
dim = 2
nx = 10               # Number of elements in the X direction.
ny = 10               # Number of elements in the Y direction.
xmin = 2
xmax = 4              # Upper X Coordinate of the generated mesh.
ymin = 2
ymax = 4
uniform_refine = 2
[]
[GlobalParams]
derivative_order = 4
[]
[Variables]
[./w]       # concentration
[../]
[./phi]   # phase field
[../]
[./T]   # temperature
[../]
[]
[ICs]
[./w]
type = ConstantIC
variable = w
value = 0.3
[../]
[./T]
type = ConstantIC
variable = T
value = 2.1
[../]
[./phi]
type = SmoothCircleIC
variable = phi
x1 = 3
y1 = 3
invalue = 1
outvalue = 0
radius = 0.1
int_width = 0.01
[../]
[]
[Kernels]
[./phi_dot]
type = SusceptibilityTimeDerivative
variable = phi
f_name = tau
[../]
[./free_energy]
type = AllenCahn
variable = phi
f_name = Fr
[../]
[./anisoACinterface1]
type = ACInterfaceKobayashi1
variable = phi
[../]
[./anisoACinterface2]
type = ACInterfaceKobayashi2
variable = phi
[../]
[./w_dot]
type = SusceptibilityTimeDerivative
variable = w
f_name = chi
coupled_variables = 'phi'
[../]
[./Diffusion]
type = MatDiffusion
variable = w
diffusivity = Dchi
coupled_variables = 'phi'
[../]
[./coupled_etaa0dot]
type = CoupledSusceptibilityTimeDerivative
variable = w
v = phi
f_name = ft
coupled_variables = 'phi'
[../]
[./coupled_antitrapping]
type = AntitrappingCurrent
variable = w
v = phi
f_name = rhodiff
[../]
[./coupled_etaa0dot_time]
type = TimeDerivative
variable = T
[../]
[./coupled_etab0dot_diff]
type = CoefDiffusion
variable = T
coef = 1e8
[../]
[./coupled_etab0dot_ctim]
type = CoefCoupledTimeDerivative
variable = T
v = phi
coef = -0.5
[../]
[]
[Materials]
[./A]
type = InterfaceOrientationMaterial
op = phi
anisotropy_strength = 0.04
mode_number = 4
outputs = exodus
[../]
[./speexpress]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'phi w T'
f_name = Fr
material_property_names = 'lambda MCi'
function = 'phi^3-phi+lambda*(1-phi^2)^2*(MCiw+T)'
output=exodus
[../]
[./mobility]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'w'
f_name = tau
material_property_names = 'tau0 Le MCi k A'
expression = 'tau0A^2*(1/Le+MCi*(1+(1-k)w))'
output=exodus
[../]
[./chemp]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'phi'
f_name = chi
material_property_names = 'k'
function = '1+k-(1-k)phi'
output=exodus
[../]
[./matdiff]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'phi'
f_name = Dchi
material_property_names = 'D'
function = 'D(1-phi)'
output=exodus
[../]
[./antitrap]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'w'
f_name = rhodiff
material_property_names = 'k wid'
function = 'wid/sqrt(2)(1+(1-k)*w)'
output=exodus
[../]
[./int]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'w'
f_name = ft
material_property_names = 'k'
function = '1+(1-k)*w'
output=exodus
[../]
[./const]
type = GenericConstantMaterial
prop_names =  'tau0   Le  MCi   k  lambda   D  wid L erp'
prop_values = '1e-5  1.0  0.15  0.15  3.1913  2.0  0.01 1 0.01'
[../]
[]
[Preconditioning]
[./SMP]
type = SMP
full = true
[../]
[]
[Executioner]
type = Transient
scheme = bdf2
solve_type = PJFNK
petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type -ksp_gmres_restart'
petsc_options_value = 'hypre    boomeramg      31'
l_tol = 1.0e-3
l_max_its = 100
nl_max_its = 100
nl_rel_tol = 1.0e-8
nl_abs_tol = 1e-8
end_time = 0.01
[./TimeStepper]
type = IterationAdaptiveDT
dt = 0.00005
cutback_factor = 0.7
growth_factor = 1.2
[../]
[]
[Adaptivity]
initial_steps = 3
max_h_level = 3
initial_marker = err_phi
[./Markers]
[./err_phi]
type = ErrorFractionMarker
coarsen = 0.3
refine = 0.95
indicator = ind_phi
[../]
[../]
[]
[Outputs]
exodus = true
interval = 10
[]
[Debug]
show_material_props = true
[]`
Is there any wrong with my input? Thanks!

Hello
This ParsedMaterial is using A
[./mobility]
type = ParsedMaterial
coupled_variables = 'w'
f_name = tau
material_property_names = 'tau0 Le MCi k A'
expression = 'tau0A^2*(1/Le+MCi*(1+(1-k)w))'
output=exodus
[../]

but A is not defined. A below is the name of the Material not the material property. You need to find the actual name of the material property, either looking at the exodus output of the show_material_props
[Materials]
[./A]
type = InterfaceOrientationMaterial
op = phi
...

Hi @GiudGiud
Thank you for your reply.
In InterfaceOrientationMaterial, I didn't find an example of naming this block, such as material_property_names, etc.
The exodus output of the show_material_props is
`The following total 8 aux variables:
ddepsdgrad_op_x
ddepsdgrad_op_y
ddepsdgrad_op_z
deps
depsdgrad_op_x
depsdgrad_op_y
depsdgrad_op_z
eps
are added for automatic output by MaterialOutputAction.
Active Materials:
Subdomain:  (0)
Material Name:       A
Property Names:      "ddepsdgrad_op" "deps" "depsdgrad_op" "eps"
Material Name:       speexpress
Property Names:      "Fr"
Material Name:       mobility
Property Names:      "tau"
Material Name:       chemp
Property Names:      "chi"
Material Name:       matdiff
Property Names:      "Dchi"
Material Name:       antitrap
Property Names:      "rhodiff"
Material Name:       int
Property Names:      "ft"
Material Name:       const
Property Names:      "D" "L" "Le" "MCi" "erp" "k" "lambda" "tau0" "wid"
Active Face Materials:
Subdomain:  (0)
  Material Name:       A_face
  Property Names:      "ddepsdgrad_op" "deps" "depsdgrad_op" "eps" 
  Material Name:       speexpress_face
  Property Names:      "Fr" 
  Material Name:       mobility_face
  Property Names:      "tau" 
  Material Name:       chemp_face
  Property Names:      "chi" 
  Material Name:       matdiff_face
  Property Names:      "Dchi" 
  Material Name:       antitrap_face
  Property Names:      "rhodiff" 
  Material Name:       int_face
  Property Names:      "ft" 
  Material Name:       const_face
  Property Names:      "D" "L" "Le" "MCi" "erp" "k" "lambda" "tau0" "wid" 

Active Neighboring Materials:
Subdomain:  (0)
Material Name:       A_neighbor
Property Names:      "ddepsdgrad_op" "deps" "depsdgrad_op" "eps"
Material Name:       speexpress_neighbor
Property Names:      "Fr"
Material Name:       mobility_neighbor
Property Names:      "tau"
Material Name:       chemp_neighbor
Property Names:      "chi"
Material Name:       matdiff_neighbor
Property Names:      "Dchi"
Material Name:       antitrap_neighbor
Property Names:      "rhodiff"
Material Name:       int_neighbor
Property Names:      "ft"
Material Name:       const_neighbor
Property Names:      "D" "L" "Le" "MCi" "erp" "k" "lambda" "tau0" "wid"
Active Boundary Materials: `

so the A you are using defines these
Property Names: "ddepsdgrad_op" "deps" "depsdgrad_op" "eps"
any of these is correct in the parsed expression you have?

Hi @GiudGiud
Thank you very much for your guidance and help. That is a stupid question. I looked at the InterfaceOrientationMaterial.C file and solved this problem.
Thanks again for your help.
Best,
Nan Liu

node.title: Residual of the weak form of the equation
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I am trying to add a source term to the navier-stokes equation. In fact, I am going to add the below term:
w*grad(c)
Here both w and c are scalar variables, so grad(c) and w*grad(c) are both vectors. How can I compute two residuals for this equation? Is there any similar MOOSE kernel that computes the residuals for similar terms?
Thanks,
Ali

Hello
So this is a source term in the momentum equation?
Which Navier Stokes discretization are you using? (finite element, but which prefix? INS? INSAD? INSFE?)
Guillaume

w and c are both coupled variables from CH equation.
Yes, this is a source term for the momentum equation and I am using INS in 2D.
Regards,
Ali

Ok great. You should be able to modify the coupledForce kernel to get what you want.
You ll need to add a kernel for each component of the momentum equations, so two kernels
